nl.quintor.solitaire.models.deck

Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Card>
          • nl.quintor.solitaire.models.deck.Deck
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Card>, Collection<Card>, List<Card>, RandomAccess

    public final class Deck
extends ArrayList<Card>
    Model of a deck of cards. The class extends ArrayList, so it provides all of the standard methods of ArrayList.

    It is recommended that an appropriate Deck object is instantiated for a game using an appropriate factory method (create[..]Deck()). This deck can then be shuffled and dealt out to other (empty) decks representing, for example, the hand of a player.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • toComparativeString

        public String toComparativeString(Comparator<Card> sorter)
        Returns a String of the cards in this Deck, ordered by the argument Comparator<Card> in ascending order, with comparison symbols (< and =) between the cards indicating how two cards compare. For example ♧ 2 < ♧ 3 = ♧ 4. The order of the cards in this Deck is NOT changed.
        Parameters:
        sorter - order in which the cards have to be sorted
        Returns:
        representation of the Cards in this Deck, with comparison indicators

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this Deck.
        Overrides:
        toString in class AbstractCollection<Card>
        Returns:
        representation of the Cards in this Deck
